places.name: Queen’s Palace
places.description: The Rova is a historic royal palace located on the highest hill of Antananarivo. It offers a panoramic view of the city and a glimpse into the Merina monarchy's legacy. Ideal for history lovers and cultural tourists.

places.name: Analakely Market
places.address: Avenue de l’Indépendance, Analakely, Antananarivo 101, Madagascar
places.description: A bustling market in the heart of the city, offering a variety of local products, crafts, and street food. Experience the vibrant culture and flavors of the region while supporting local artisans and farmers.

places.name: Lemur Park
places.description: A unique wildlife park dedicated to the conservation of Madagascar's lemurs. Visitors can observe these fascinating creatures in their natural habitat while learning about the importance of biodiversity and conservation efforts.

places.name: Tana Water Front
places.description: A modern business and shopping center that includes restaurants, banks, boutiques, and conference spaces. It’s ideal for business lunches and relaxed meetings.

places.name: Tsimbazaza Zoo
places.description: This national zoo includes a museum and offers a good overview of Madagascar's unique fauna and flora. It’s both educational and entertaining for visitors of all ages.

places.name: Ambohimanga Hill
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and sacred royal city, Ambohimanga is considered the spiritual heart of the Merina Kingdom. It’s ideal for cultural immersion and scenic views.

places.name: Is'Art Galerie
places.description: A dynamic contemporary art gallery hosting local and international artists. It’s also a cultural hub with events, exhibitions, and live music – great for networking and art lovers.

places.name: Lake Anosy
places.description: A peaceful spot in the middle of the city featuring a small lake with a central monument. It’s an iconic photo location and a place for a quiet walk or informal meetings.
